tasks.title: Setup Express.js Server and Project Structure
tasks.description: Initialize the Node.js project with Express.js server, configure middleware, and establish the basic project structure.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify server starts without errors
2. Test health check endpoint returns 200 status
3. Confirm static file serving works correctly
4. Validate CORS configuration with cross-origin requests
5. Test error handling middleware with invalid routes

tasks.title: Implement YouTube API Integration
tasks.description: Integrate with YouTube Data API v3 to fetch video metadata and validate YouTube URLs.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test URL extraction with all supported formats
2. Verify metadata extraction with various video types
3. Test error handling for invalid URLs and videos
4. Validate rate limit handling
5. Verify caching mechanism reduces API calls
6. Test with videos that have different metadata availability

tasks.title: Develop Basic Frontend Interface
tasks.description: Create the initial HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for the frontend interface with form submission and results display.

2. Verify responsive design on different screen sizes

5. Test UI rendering with different types of results
6. Verify error messages are displayed correctly

tasks.title: Implement Transcript Extraction System
tasks.description: Create a robust transcript extraction system with multiple fallback methods to handle different YouTube video types.
tasks.testStrategy:

2. Test with auto-generated captions
3. Test fallback to description when no captions available
4. Verify timestamp formatting is correct
5. Test with videos in different languages
6. Validate error handling for each extraction method
7. Test caching mechanism reduces API calls

tasks.title: Integrate OpenRouter API for AI Analysis
tasks.description: Implement integration with OpenRouter API to access multiple AI models for content analysis.

2. Verify token limit handling with large transcripts
3. Test prompt template system with different templates
4. Validate error handling for API failures
5. Test with videos of varying lengths and content types
6. Verify cost estimation accuracy

tasks.title: Implement Analysis API Endpoint
tasks.description: Create the main API endpoint that orchestrates the video analysis process, combining YouTube metadata, transcript extraction, and AI analysis.

2. Verify error handling for each step of the process
3. Test with different AI models and token limits

5. Test timeout handling for long-running analyses
6. Verify rate limiting functionality

tasks.title: Implement Custom Prompts System
tasks.description: Create a system for managing and using custom analysis prompts with template placeholders.

2. Verify custom prompt creation and loading
3. Test prompt caching mechanism
4. Validate placeholder replacement functionality
5. Test API endpoints for prompt management
6. Verify frontend prompt selection interface

tasks.title: Implement File Download System

tasks.testStrategy:

2. Verify file download functionality
3. Test with different file formats
4. Validate file cleanup mechanism
5. Test with large files

tasks.title: Implement Notion API Integration

2. Verify database listing functionality

4. Validate markdown to Notion blocks conversion

6. Verify two-tier structure creation

tasks.title: Implement Advanced Transcript Processing
tasks.description: Enhance transcript extraction with language detection, formatting, and fallback mechanisms.

tasks.title: Create Comprehensive Documentation and Testing
tasks.description: Develop comprehensive documentation, testing, and deployment instructions for the application.
tasks.details:
1. Create README.md with detailed setup and usage instructions:
```markdown
# YouTube Video Research App

A powerful web application that analyzes YouTube videos and generates comprehensive markdown reports with AI-driven insights.

## Features

- Extract metadata, transcripts, and descriptions from any YouTube video
- Generate AI-powered analysis using multiple models (GPT-3.5, GPT-4, Claude, etc.)
- Use specialized templates for different video types
- Save notes directly to Notion databases
- Download analysis in multiple formats
- Modern, responsive web interface

## Setup Instructions

### Prerequisites

- Node.js v14 or higher
- npm or yarn
- API keys for required services

### Installation

1. Clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/yourusername/youtube-research-app.git
   cd youtube-research-app
   ```

2. Install dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. Create a `.env` file in the root directory with the following variables:
   ```
   PORT=3000
   YOUTUBE_API_KEY=your_youtube_api_key
   OPENROUTER_API_KEY=your_openrouter_api_key
   APIFY_API_TOKEN=your_apify_token (optional)
   APP_URL=http://localhost:3000
   NODE_ENV=development
   ```

4. Start the development server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

5. Open your browser and navigate to `http://localhost:3000`

### API Keys

- **YouTube API Key**: Create a project in the [Google Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/), enable the YouTube Data API v3, and generate an API key.
- **OpenRouter API Key**: Sign up at [OpenRouter](https://openrouter.ai/) and create an API key.
- **Apify Token** (optional): Sign up at [Apify](https://apify.com/) and get your API token.

## Usage Guide

### Basic Analysis

1. Enter a YouTube URL in the input field
2. Select an AI model (GPT-3.5 Turbo recommended for most cases)
3. Choose an analysis template
4. Set the token limit for analysis depth
5. Click "Analyze Video"
6. View the generated analysis
7. Download the report or save to Notion

### Notion Integration

1. Create a Notion integration at [Notion Developers](https://www.notion.so/my-integrations)
2. Share your database with the integration
3. Copy the integration token
4. Enter the token in the app's Notion settings
5. Select your target database
6. Analyze videos and save directly to Notion

### Custom Prompts

1. Create a markdown file with your custom prompt template
2. Use placeholders like `{{VIDEO_TITLE}}`, `{{CHANNEL_NAME}}`, etc.
3. Place the file in the `prompts/custom` directory
4. Reload prompts in the app
5. Select your custom prompt from the dropdown

## Development

### Project Structure

```
/
 public/              # Frontend assets
    index.html      # Main HTML file
    script.js       # Frontend JavaScript
    styles.css      # CSS styles
 routes/             # API route handlers
 services/           # Business logic
 middleware/         # Express middleware
 prompts/            # Analysis templates
    default/        # Default templates
    custom/         # User-added templates
 utils/              # Helper functions
 server.js           # Main application server
 package.json        # Dependencies and scripts
```

### API Endpoints

- `POST /api/analyze` - Analyze a YouTube video
- `GET /api/prompts` - List available prompt templates
- `POST /api/prompts` - Add a custom prompt template
- `POST /api/download/markdown` - Generate a markdown download
- `GET /api/download/:id/:filename` - Download a generated file
- `POST /api/notion/connect` - Connect to Notion
- `GET /api/notion/databases` - List available Notion databases
- `POST /api/notion/save` - Save analysis to Notion
- `GET /api/models` - List available AI models
- `GET /api/health` - Check system health

## Deployment

### Deploying to Heroku

1. Create a Heroku account and install the Heroku CLI
2. Login to Heroku: `heroku login`
3. Create a new Heroku app: `heroku create your-app-name`
4. Add environment variables: `heroku config:set YOUTUBE_API_KEY=your_key`
5. Deploy the app: `git push heroku main`

### Deploying to Vercel

1. Install Vercel CLI: `npm install -g vercel`
2. Login to Vercel: `vercel login`
3. Deploy the app: `vercel`
4. Set environment variables in the Vercel dashboard

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please feel free to submit a Pull Request.

## License

This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the LICENSE file for details.
```
2. Create API documentation with endpoint details
3. Implement unit tests for core services:
```javascript
// Example test for YouTube service
const { extractVideoId } = require('../services/youtube');

describe('YouTube Service', () => {
  test('extractVideoId should parse standard YouTube URL', () => {
    const url = 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ';
    expect(extractVideoId(url)).toBe('dQw4w9WgXcQ');
  });
  
  test('extractVideoId should parse shortened URL', () => {
    const url = 'https://youtu.be/dQw4w9WgXcQ';
    expect(extractVideoId(url)).toBe('dQw4w9WgXcQ');
  });
  
  test('extractVideoId should parse embed URL', () => {
    const url = 'https://youtube.com/embed/dQw4w9WgXcQ';
    expect(extractVideoId(url)).toBe('dQw4w9WgXcQ');
  });
  
  test('extractVideoId should parse shorts URL', () => {
    const url = 'https://youtube.com/shorts/dQw4w9WgXcQ';
    expect(extractVideoId(url)).toBe('dQw4w9WgXcQ');
  });
  
  test('extractVideoId should throw error for invalid URL', () => {
    const url = 'https://example.com/video';
    expect(() => extractVideoId(url)).toThrow('Invalid YouTube URL format');
  });
});
```
4. Create deployment scripts and instructions
5. Add environment variable documentation
6. Create user guide with screenshots
7. Implement end-to-end testing
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify documentation accuracy and completeness
2. Test installation process on different platforms
3. Run unit tests for all core services
4. Validate API documentation against actual endpoints
5. Test deployment scripts
6. Verify environment variable documentation
7. Test user guide with actual usage scenarios
